history.content:
This is a really hard question to answer. As EE16B is not required for LSCS students, we don't know how many will opt to take the class. We have saved some seats for CS-intended freshmen, but we just don't know how many will actually want to take 16B and we have so many students that we have to divide the seats. The faculty have explained that EE16AB and CS61B are helpful for CS 70 so as a CS-intended student you may want to take 16B.

If you really want to take this class, then you should use Phase I units. If you are more flexible, then use Phase II. You could still get into 16B with Phase II, but again we just don't know how many CS-intended first years will opt to take 16B in spring.

The enrollment policy says, regarding EE 16B:

Any first-year Undeclared Letters & Science student (Computer-Science intended) may enroll directly into this class provided there is space.

So, as a first year, is it safe to Phase II EE 16B?
history.subject: EE16B: Phase I or II for L&S CS-Intended Freshman
